intro: Diphragmus scaber, commonly known as the rough diphragm, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cucurbitaceae, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. The fruit is a hairy, elongated capsule that contains several seeds.
